name: 13 Laurel Road
description:
13 Laurel Road is an interactive fiction game about the relationships we have with places and reconciling with trauma. You play as a young man named Noah who has been tasked with picking up some things from his cousin’s old house. You haven’t been there since it happened. As you explore the house, you remember the things that led you here- the things you’d rather not think about.

Warning: This game includes mentions of transphobia, abuse, murder, and self harm.

It is designed to be played on computers and should work fine on tablets, though it isn't formatted for phones.

Thank you to everyone who's supported me and made this project possible, whether with advice and feedback, kind words, or sharing my work around <3

If you want to keep up with my future projects and support my work, you can check out my dev blog. Over there I post updates, artwork, musings, and general chaos. Also check out the first game in this (non-linear) series, An Angel Among the Aspens.
